verses.arabic: كٓهيعٓصٓ
verses.translation: Kaf. Ha. Ya. 'Ain. Sad.
verses.transliteration: Kaf-ha-ya-AAayn-sad

verses.arabic: ذِكْرُ رَحْمَتِ رَبِّكَ عَبْدَهُۥ زَكَرِيَّآ
verses.translation: (This is) a recital of the Mercy of thy Lord to His servant Zakariya.
verses.transliteration: Thikru rahmati rabbika AAabdahuzakariyya

verses.arabic: إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥ نِدَآءً خَفِيًّا
verses.translation: Behold! he cried to his Lord in secret,
verses.transliteration: Ith nada rabbahu nidaankhafiyya

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى وَهَنَ ٱلْعَظْمُ مِنِّى وَٱشْتَعَلَ ٱلرَّأْسُ شَيْبًا وَلَمْ أَكُنۢ بِدُعَآئِكَ رَبِّ شَقِيًّا
verses.translation: Praying: "O my Lord! infirm indeed are my bones, and the hair of my head doth glisten with grey: but never am I unblest, O my Lord, in my prayer to Thee!
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbi innee wahana alAAathmuminnee washtaAAala arra/su shayban walam akunbiduAAa-ika rabbi shaqiyya

verses.arabic: وَإِنِّى خِفْتُ ٱلْمَوَٰلِىَ مِن وَرَآءِى وَكَانَتِ ٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرًا فَهَبْ لِى مِن لَّدُنكَ وَلِيًّا
verses.translation: "Now I fear (what) my relatives (and colleagues) (will do) after me: but my wife is barren: so give me an heir as from Thyself,-
verses.transliteration: Wa-innee khiftu almawaliya min wara-eewakanati imraatee AAaqiran fahab lee min ladunkawaliyya

verses.arabic: يَرِثُنِى وَيَرِثُ مِنْ ءَالِ يَعْقُوبَ ۖ وَٱجْعَلْهُ رَبِّ رَضِيًّا
verses.translation: "(One that) will (truly) represent me, and represent the posterity of Jacob; and make him, O my Lord! one with whom Thou art well-pleased!"
verses.transliteration: Yarithunee wayarithu min ali yaAAqoobawajAAalhu rabbi radiyya

verses.arabic: يَـٰزَكَرِيَّآ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَـٰمٍ ٱسْمُهُۥ يَحْيَىٰ لَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مِن قَبْلُ سَمِيًّا
verses.translation: (His prayer was answered): "O Zakariya! We give thee good news of a son: His name shall be Yahya: on none by that name have We conferred distinction before."
verses.transliteration: Ya zakariyya innanubashshiruka bighulamin ismuhu yahya lamnajAAal lahu min qablu samiyya

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى غُلَـٰمٌ وَكَانَتِ ٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرًا وَقَدْ بَلَغْتُ مِنَ ٱلْكِبَرِ عِتِيًّا
verses.translation: He said: "O my Lord! How shall I have a son, when my wife is barren and I have grown quite decrepit from old age?"
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbi anna yakoonu leeghulamun wakanati imraatee AAaqiran waqadbalaghtu mina alkibari AAitiyya

verses.arabic: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَىَّ هَيِّنٌ وَقَدْ خَلَقْتُكَ مِن قَبْلُ وَلَمْ تَكُ شَيْـًٔا
verses.translation: He said: "So (it will be) thy Lord saith, 'that is easy for Me: I did indeed create thee before, when thou hadst been nothing!'"
verses.transliteration: Qala kathalika qalarabbuka huwa AAalayya hayyinun waqad khalaqtuka min qablu walamtaku shay-a

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱجْعَل لِّىٓ ءَايَةً ۚ قَالَ ءَايَتُكَ أَلَّا تُكَلِّمَ ٱلنَّاسَ ثَلَـٰثَ لَيَالٍ سَوِيًّا
verses.translation: (Zakariya) said: "O my Lord! give me a Sign." "Thy Sign," was the answer, "Shall be that thou shalt speak to no man for three nights, although thou art not dumb."
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbi ijAAal lee ayatan qalaayatuka alla tukallima annasa thalathalayalin sawiyya

verses.arabic: فَخَرَجَ عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلْمِحْرَابِ فَأَوْحَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِمْ أَن سَبِّحُوا۟ بُكْرَةً وَعَشِيًّا
verses.translation: So Zakariya came out to his people from him chamber: He told them by signs to celebrate Allah's praises in the morning and in the evening.
verses.transliteration: Fakharaja AAala qawmihi mina almihrabifaawha ilayhim an sabbihoo bukratan waAAashiyya

verses.arabic: يَـٰيَحْيَىٰ خُذِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِقُوَّةٍ ۖ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ ٱلْحُكْمَ صَبِيًّا
verses.translation: (To his son came the command): "O Yahya! take hold of the Book with might": and We gave him Wisdom even as a youth,
verses.transliteration: Ya yahya khuthialkitaba biquwwatin waataynahu alhukmasabiyya

verses.arabic: وَحَنَانًا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَزَكَوٰةً ۖ وَكَانَ تَقِيًّا
verses.translation: And piety (for all creatures) as from Us, and purity: He was devout,
verses.transliteration: Wahananan min ladunnawazakatan wakana taqiyya

verses.arabic: وَبَرًّۢا بِوَٰلِدَيْهِ وَلَمْ يَكُن جَبَّارًا عَصِيًّا
verses.translation: And kind to his parents, and he was not overbearing or rebellious.
verses.transliteration: Wabarran biwalidayhi walam yakun jabbaranAAasiyya

verses.arabic: وَسَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْهِ يَوْمَ وُلِدَ وَيَوْمَ يَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ يُبْعَثُ حَيًّا
verses.translation: So Peace on him the day he was born, the day that he dies, and the day that he will be raised up to life (again)!
verses.transliteration: Wasalamun AAalayhi yawma wulidawayawma yamootu wayawma yubAAathu hayya

verses.arabic: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مَرْيَمَ إِذِ ٱنتَبَذَتْ مِنْ أَهْلِهَا مَكَانًا شَرْقِيًّا
verses.translation: Relate in the Book (the story of) Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place in the East.
verses.transliteration: Wathkur fee alkitabimaryama ithi intabathat min ahliha makanansharqiyya

verses.arabic: فَٱتَّخَذَتْ مِن دُونِهِمْ حِجَابًا فَأَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَيْهَا رُوحَنَا فَتَمَثَّلَ لَهَا بَشَرًا سَوِيًّا
verses.translation: She placed a screen (to screen herself) from them; then We sent her our angel, and he appeared before her as a man in all respects.
verses.transliteration: Fattakhathat min doonihim hijabanfaarsalna ilayha roohanafatamaththala laha basharan sawiyya

verses.arabic: قَالَتْ إِنِّىٓ أَعُوذُ بِٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مِنكَ إِن كُنتَ تَقِيًّا
verses.translation: She said: "I seek refuge from thee to (Allah) Most Gracious: (come not near) if thou dost fear Allah."
verses.transliteration: Qalat innee aAAoothu birrahmaniminka in kunta taqiyya

verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ رَسُولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلَـٰمًا زَكِيًّا
verses.translation: He said: "Nay, I am only a messenger from thy Lord, (to announce) to thee the gift of a holy son.
verses.transliteration: Qala innama ana rasoolurabbiki li-ahaba laki ghulaman zakiyya

verses.arabic: قَالَتْ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى غُلَـٰمٌ وَلَمْ يَمْسَسْنِى بَشَرٌ وَلَمْ أَكُ بَغِيًّا
verses.translation: She said: "How shall I have a son, seeing that no man has touched me, and I am not unchaste?"
verses.transliteration: Qalat anna yakoonu lee ghulamunwalam yamsasnee basharun walam aku baghiyya

verses.arabic: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَىَّ هَيِّنٌ ۖ وَلِنَجْعَلَهُۥٓ ءَايَةً لِّلنَّاسِ وَرَحْمَةً مِّنَّا ۚ وَكَانَ أَمْرًا مَّقْضِيًّا
verses.translation: He said: "So (it will be): Thy Lord saith, 'that is easy for Me: and (We wish) to appoint him as a Sign unto men and a Mercy from Us': It is a matter (so) decreed."
verses.transliteration: Qala kathaliki qalarabbuki huwa AAalayya hayyinun walinajAAalahu ayatan linnasiwarahmatan minna wakana amran maqdiyya

verses.arabic: ۞ فَحَمَلَتْهُ فَٱنتَبَذَتْ بِهِۦ مَكَانًا قَصِيًّا
verses.translation: So she conceived him, and she retired with him to a remote place.
verses.transliteration: Fahamalat-hu fantabathatbihi makanan qasiyya

verses.arabic: فَأَجَآءَهَا ٱلْمَخَاضُ إِلَىٰ جِذْعِ ٱلنَّخْلَةِ قَالَتْ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى مِتُّ قَبْلَ هَـٰذَا وَكُنتُ نَسْيًا مَّنسِيًّا
verses.translation: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm-tree: She cried (in her anguish): "Ah! would that I had died before this! would that I had been a thing forgotten and out of sight!"
verses.transliteration: Faajaaha almakhadu ilajithAAi annakhlati qalat ya laytaneemittu qabla hatha wakuntu nasyan mansiyya

verses.arabic: فَنَادَىٰهَا مِن تَحْتِهَآ أَلَّا تَحْزَنِى قَدْ جَعَلَ رَبُّكِ تَحْتَكِ سَرِيًّا
verses.translation: But (a voice) cried to her from beneath the (palm-tree): "Grieve not! for thy Lord hath provided a rivulet beneath thee;
verses.transliteration: Fanadaha min tahtihaalla tahzanee qad jaAAala rabbuki tahtakisariyya

verses.arabic: وَهُزِّىٓ إِلَيْكِ بِجِذْعِ ٱلنَّخْلَةِ تُسَـٰقِطْ عَلَيْكِ رُطَبًا جَنِيًّا
verses.translation: "And shake towards thyself the trunk of the palm-tree: It will let fall fresh ripe dates upon thee.
verses.transliteration: Wahuzzee ilayki bijithAAi annakhlatitusaqit AAalayki rutaban janiyya

verses.arabic: فَكُلِى وَٱشْرَبِى وَقَرِّى عَيْنًا ۖ فَإِمَّا تَرَيِنَّ مِنَ ٱلْبَشَرِ أَحَدًا فَقُولِىٓ إِنِّى نَذَرْتُ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ صَوْمًا فَلَنْ أُكَلِّمَ ٱلْيَوْمَ إِنسِيًّا
verses.translation: "So eat and drink and cool (thine) eye. And if thou dost see any man, say, 'I have vowed a fast to (Allah) Most Gracious, and this day will I enter into not talk with any human being'"
verses.transliteration: Fakulee washrabee waqarree AAaynanfa-imma tarayinna mina albashari ahadan faqooleeinnee nathartu lirrahmani sawmanfalan okallima alyawma insiyya

verses.arabic: فَأَتَتْ بِهِۦ قَوْمَهَا تَحْمِلُهُۥ ۖ قَالُوا۟ يَـٰمَرْيَمُ لَقَدْ جِئْتِ شَيْـًٔا فَرِيًّا
verses.translation: At length she brought the (babe) to her people, carrying him (in her arms). They said: "O Mary! truly an amazing thing hast thou brought!
verses.transliteration: Faatat bihi qawmaha tahmiluhuqaloo ya maryamu laqad ji/ti shay-an fariyya

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأُخْتَ هَـٰرُونَ مَا كَانَ أَبُوكِ ٱمْرَأَ سَوْءٍ وَمَا كَانَتْ أُمُّكِ بَغِيًّا
verses.translation: "O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a man of evil, nor thy mother a woman unchaste!"
verses.transliteration: Ya okhta haroona ma kanaabooki imraa saw-in wama kanat ommuki baghiyya

verses.arabic: فَأَشَارَتْ إِلَيْهِ ۖ قَالُوا۟ كَيْفَ نُكَلِّمُ مَن كَانَ فِى ٱلْمَهْدِ صَبِيًّا
verses.translation: But she pointed to the babe. They said: "How can we talk to one who is a child in the cradle?"
verses.transliteration: Faasharat ilayhi qaloo kayfanukallimu man kana fee almahdi sabiyya

verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنِّى عَبْدُ ٱللَّهِ ءَاتَىٰنِىَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَجَعَلَنِى نَبِيًّا
verses.translation: He said: "I am indeed a servant of Allah: He hath given me revelation and made me a prophet;
verses.transliteration: Qala innee AAabdu Allahi ataniyaalkitaba wajaAAalanee nabiyya

verses.arabic: وَجَعَلَنِى مُبَارَكًا أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُ وَأَوْصَـٰنِى بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱلزَّكَوٰةِ مَا دُمْتُ حَيًّا
verses.translation: "And He hath made me blessed wheresoever I be, and hath enjoined on me Prayer and Charity as long as I live;
verses.transliteration: WajaAAalanee mubarakan aynamakuntu waawsanee bissalati wazzakatima dumtu hayya

verses.arabic: وَبَرًّۢا بِوَٰلِدَتِى وَلَمْ يَجْعَلْنِى جَبَّارًا شَقِيًّا
verses.translation: "(He) hath made me kind to my mother, and not overbearing or miserable;
verses.transliteration: Wabarran biwalidatee walam yajAAalneejabbaran shaqiyya

verses.arabic: وَٱلسَّلَـٰمُ عَلَىَّ يَوْمَ وُلِدتُّ وَيَوْمَ أَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ أُبْعَثُ حَيًّا
verses.translation: "So peace is on me the day I was born, the day that I die, and the day that I shall be raised up to life (again)"!
verses.transliteration: Wassalamu AAalayya yawmawulidtu wayawma amootu wayawma obAAathu hayya

verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ عِيسَى ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ ۚ قَوْلَ ٱلْحَقِّ ٱلَّذِى فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ
verses.translation: Such (was) Jesus the son of Mary: (it is) a statement of truth, about which they (vainly) dispute.
verses.transliteration: Thalika AAeesa ibnu maryamaqawla alhaqqi allathee feehi yamtaroon

verses.arabic: مَا كَانَ لِلَّهِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ مِن وَلَدٍ ۖ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥٓ ۚ إِذَا قَضَىٰٓ أَمْرًا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
verses.translation: It is not befitting to (the majesty of) Allah that He should beget a son. Glory be to Him! when He determines a matter, He only says to it, "Be", and it is.
verses.transliteration: Ma kana lillahi anyattakhitha min waladin subhanahu itha qadaamran fa-innama yaqoolu lahu kun fayakoon

verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ رَبِّى وَرَبُّكُمْ فَٱعْبُدُوهُ ۚ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ
verses.translation: Verily Allah is my Lord and your Lord: Him therefore serve ye: this is a Way that is straight.
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna Allaha rabbee warabbukum faAAbudoohuhatha siratun mustaqeem

verses.arabic: فَٱخْتَلَفَ ٱلْأَحْزَابُ مِنۢ بَيْنِهِمْ ۖ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن مَّشْهَدِ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.translation: But the sects differ among themselves: and woe to the unbelievers because of the (coming) Judgment of a Momentous Day!
verses.transliteration: Fakhtalafa al-ahzabumin baynihim fawaylun lillatheena kafaroo min mashhadiyawmin AAatheem

verses.arabic: أَسْمِعْ بِهِمْ وَأَبْصِرْ يَوْمَ يَأْتُونَنَا ۖ لَـٰكِنِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ ٱلْيَوْمَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: How plainly will they see and hear, the Day that they will appear before Us! but the unjust today are in error manifest!
verses.transliteration: AsmiAA bihim waabsir yawma ya/toonanalakini aththalimoona alyawmafee dalalin mubeen

verses.arabic: وَأَنذِرْهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْحَسْرَةِ إِذْ قُضِىَ ٱلْأَمْرُ وَهُمْ فِى غَفْلَةٍ وَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.translation: But warn them of the Day of Distress, when the matter will be determined: for (behold,) they are negligent and they do not believe!
verses.transliteration: Waanthirhum yawma alhasrati ithqudiya al-amru wahum fee ghaflatin wahum layu/minoon

verses.arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَرِثُ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَنْ عَلَيْهَا وَإِلَيْنَا يُرْجَعُونَ
verses.translation: It is We Who will inherit the earth, and all beings thereon: to Us will they all be returned.
verses.transliteration: Inna nahnu narithu al-ardawaman AAalayha wa-ilayna yurjaAAoon

verses.arabic: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صِدِّيقًا نَّبِيًّا
verses.translation: (Also mention in the Book (the story of) Abraham: He was a man of Truth, a prophet.
verses.transliteration: Wathkur fee alkitabiibraheema innahu kana siddeeqan nabiyya

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ لِمَ تَعْبُدُ مَا لَا يَسْمَعُ وَلَا يُبْصِرُ وَلَا يُغْنِى عَنكَ شَيْـًٔا
verses.translation: Behold, he said to his father: "O my father! why worship that which heareth not and seeth not, and can profit thee nothing?
verses.transliteration: Ith qala li-abeehi yaabati lima taAAbudu ma la yasmaAAu wala yubsiruwala yughnee AAanka shay-a

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَبَتِ إِنِّى قَدْ جَآءَنِى مِنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ مَا لَمْ يَأْتِكَ فَٱتَّبِعْنِىٓ أَهْدِكَ صِرَٰطًا سَوِيًّا
verses.translation: "O my father! to me hath come knowledge which hath not reached thee: so follow me: I will guide thee to a way that is even and straight.
verses.transliteration: Ya abati innee qad jaanee minaalAAilmi ma lam ya/tika fattabiAAnee ahdika siratansawiyya

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَبَتِ لَا تَعْبُدِ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ كَانَ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَصِيًّا
verses.translation: "O my father! serve not Satan: for Satan is a rebel against (Allah) Most Gracious.
verses.transliteration: Ya abati la taAAbudi ashshaytanainna ashshaytana kana lirrahmaniAAasiyya

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَبَتِ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يَمَسَّكَ عَذَابٌ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ فَتَكُونَ لِلشَّيْطَـٰنِ وَلِيًّا
verses.translation: "O my father! I fear lest a Penalty afflict thee from (Allah) Most Gracious, so that thou become to Satan a friend."
verses.transliteration: Ya abati innee akhafu anyamassaka AAathabun mina arrahmanifatakoona lishshyatani waliyya

verses.arabic: قَالَ أَرَاغِبٌ أَنتَ عَنْ ءَالِهَتِى يَـٰٓإِبْرَٰهِيمُ ۖ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ لَأَرْجُمَنَّكَ ۖ وَٱهْجُرْنِى مَلِيًّا
verses.translation: (The father) replied: "Dost thou hate my gods, O Abraham? If thou forbear not, I will indeed stone thee: Now get away from me for a good long while!"
verses.transliteration: Qala araghibun anta AAan alihateeya ibraheemu la-in lam tantahi laarjumannaka wahjurneemaliyya

verses.arabic: قَالَ سَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْكَ ۖ سَأَسْتَغْفِرُ لَكَ رَبِّىٓ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ بِى حَفِيًّا
verses.translation: Abraham said: "Peace be on thee: I will pray to my Lord for thy forgiveness: for He is to me Most Gracious.
verses.transliteration: Qala salamun AAalaykasaastaghfiru laka rabbee innahu kana bee hafiyya

verses.arabic: وَأَعْتَزِلُكُمْ وَمَا تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَدْعُوا۟ رَبِّى عَسَىٰٓ أَلَّآ أَكُونَ بِدُعَآءِ رَبِّى شَقِيًّا
verses.translation: "And I will turn away from you (all) and from those whom ye invoke besides Allah: I will call on my Lord: perhaps, by my prayer to my Lord, I shall be not unblest."
verses.transliteration: WaaAAtazilukum wama tadAAoona mindooni Allahi waadAAoo rabbee AAasa allaakoona biduAAa-i rabbee shaqiyya

verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا ٱعْتَزَلَهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَهَبْنَا لَهُۥٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ ۖ وَكُلًّا جَعَلْنَا نَبِيًّا
verses.translation: When he had turned away from them and from those whom they worshipped besides Allah, We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and each one of them We made a prophet.
verses.transliteration: Falamma iAAtazalahum wamayaAAbudoona min dooni Allahi wahabna lahu ishaqawayaAAqooba wakullan jaAAalna nabiyya

verses.arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِنَا وَجَعَلْنَا لَهُمْ لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ عَلِيًّا
verses.translation: And We bestowed of Our Mercy on them, and We granted them lofty honour on the tongue of truth.
verses.transliteration: Wawahabna lahum min rahmatinawajaAAalna lahum lisana sidqin AAaliyya

verses.arabic: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مُوسَىٰٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مُخْلَصًا وَكَانَ رَسُولًا نَّبِيًّا
verses.translation: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was specially chosen, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.
verses.transliteration: Wathkur fee alkitabimoosa innahu kana mukhlasan wakanarasoolan nabiyya

verses.arabic: وَنَـٰدَيْنَـٰهُ مِن جَانِبِ ٱلطُّورِ ٱلْأَيْمَنِ وَقَرَّبْنَـٰهُ نَجِيًّا
verses.translation: And we called him from the right side of Mount (Sinai), and made him draw near to Us, for mystic (converse).
verses.transliteration: Wanadaynahu min janibiattoori al-aymani waqarrabnahu najiyya

verses.arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥ مِن رَّحْمَتِنَآ أَخَاهُ هَـٰرُونَ نَبِيًّا
verses.translation: And, out of Our Mercy, We gave him his brother Aaron, (also) a prophet.
verses.transliteration: Wawahabna lahu min rahmatinaakhahu haroona nabiyya

verses.arabic: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ إِسْمَـٰعِيلَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صَادِقَ ٱلْوَعْدِ وَكَانَ رَسُولًا نَّبِيًّا
verses.translation: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Isma'il: He was (strictly) true to what he promised, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.
verses.transliteration: Wathkur fee alkitabiismaAAeela innahu kana sadiqa alwaAAdi wakanarasoolan nabiyya

verses.arabic: وَكَانَ يَأْمُرُ أَهْلَهُۥ بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱلزَّكَوٰةِ وَكَانَ عِندَ رَبِّهِۦ مَرْضِيًّا
verses.translation: He used to enjoin on his people Prayer and Charity, and he was most acceptable in the sight of his Lord.
verses.transliteration: Wakana ya/muru ahlahu bissalatiwazzakati wakana AAinda rabbihi mardiyya

verses.arabic: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ إِدْرِيسَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صِدِّيقًا نَّبِيًّا
verses.translation: Also mention in the Book the case of Idris: He was a man of truth (and sincerity), (and) a prophet:
verses.transliteration: Wathkur fee alkitabiidreesa innahu kana siddeeqan nabiyya

verses.arabic: وَرَفَعْنَـٰهُ مَكَانًا عَلِيًّا
verses.translation: And We raised him to a lofty station.
verses.transliteration: WarafaAAnahu makanan AAaliyya

verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَنْعَمَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ مِن ذُرِّيَّةِ ءَادَمَ وَمِمَّنْ حَمَلْنَا مَعَ نُوحٍ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّةِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَمِمَّنْ هَدَيْنَا وَٱجْتَبَيْنَآ ۚ إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ خَرُّوا۟ سُجَّدًا وَبُكِيًّا ۩
verses.translation: Those were some of the prophets on whom Allah did bestow His Grace,- of the posterity of Adam, and of those who We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and of the posterity of Abraham and Israel of those whom We guided and chose. Whenever the Signs of (Allah) Most Gracious were rehearsed to them, they would fall down in prostrate adoration and in tears.
verses.transliteration: Ola-ika allatheena anAAama AllahuAAalayhim mina annabiyyeena min thurriyyati adamawamimman hamalna maAAa noohin wamin thurriyyatiibraheema wa-isra-eela wamimman hadayna wajtabaynaitha tutla AAalayhim ayatu arrahmanikharroo sujjadan wabukiyya

verses.arabic: ۞ فَخَلَفَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ خَلْفٌ أَضَاعُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ ٱلشَّهَوَٰتِ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَلْقَوْنَ غَيًّا
verses.translation: But after them there followed a posterity who missed prayers and followed after lusts soon, then, will they face Destruction,-
verses.transliteration: Fakhalafa min baAAdihim khalfun adaAAooassalata wattabaAAoo ashshahawatifasawfa yalqawna ghayya

verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًا فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَدْخُلُونَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ وَلَا يُظْلَمُونَ شَيْـًٔا
verses.translation: Except those who repent and believe, and work righteousness: for these will enter the Garden and will not be wronged in the least,-
verses.transliteration: Illa man taba waamanawaAAamila salihan faola-ika yadkhuloonaaljannata wala yuthlamoona shay-a

verses.arabic: جَنَّـٰتِ عَدْنٍ ٱلَّتِى وَعَدَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ عِبَادَهُۥ بِٱلْغَيْبِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ وَعْدُهُۥ مَأْتِيًّا
verses.translation: Gardens of Eternity, those which (Allah) Most Gracious has promised to His servants in the Unseen: for His promise must (necessarily) come to pass.
verses.transliteration: Jannati AAadnin allatee waAAada arrahmanuAAibadahu bighaybi innahu kana waAAduhuma/tiyya

verses.arabic: لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا إِلَّا سَلَـٰمًا ۖ وَلَهُمْ رِزْقُهُمْ فِيهَا بُكْرَةً وَعَشِيًّا
verses.translation: They will not there hear any vain discourse, but only salutations of Peace: And they will have therein their sustenance, morning and evening.
verses.transliteration: La yasmaAAoona feeha laghwanilla salaman walahum rizquhum feeha bukratanwaAAashiyya

verses.arabic: تِلْكَ ٱلْجَنَّةُ ٱلَّتِى نُورِثُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا مَن كَانَ تَقِيًّا
verses.translation: Such is the Garden which We give as an inheritance to those of Our servants who guard against Evil.
verses.transliteration: Tilka aljannatu allatee noorithu min AAibadinaman kana taqiyya

verses.arabic: وَمَا نَتَنَزَّلُ إِلَّا بِأَمْرِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لَهُۥ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِينَا وَمَا خَلْفَنَا وَمَا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ ۚ وَمَا كَانَ رَبُّكَ نَسِيًّا
verses.translation: (The angels say:) "We descend not but by command of thy Lord: to Him belongeth what is before us and what is behind us, and what is between: and thy Lord never doth forget,-
verses.transliteration: Wama natanazzalu illa bi-amrirabbika lahu ma bayna aydeena wama khalfanawama bayna thalika wama kana rabbukanasiyya

verses.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فَٱعْبُدْهُ وَٱصْطَبِرْ لِعِبَـٰدَتِهِۦ ۚ هَلْ تَعْلَمُ لَهُۥ سَمِيًّا
verses.translation: "Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and of all that is between them; so worship Him, and be constant and patient in His worship: knowest thou of any who is worthy of the same Name as He?"
verses.transliteration: Rabbu assamawati wal-ardiwama baynahuma faAAbudhu wastabirliAAibadatihi hal taAAlamu lahu samiyya

verses.arabic: وَيَقُولُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَءِذَا مَا مِتُّ لَسَوْفَ أُخْرَجُ حَيًّا
verses.translation: Man says: "What! When I am dead, shall I then be raised up alive?"
verses.transliteration: Wayaqoolu al-insanu a-itha mamittu lasawfa okhraju hayya

verses.arabic: أَوَلَا يَذْكُرُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰهُ مِن قَبْلُ وَلَمْ يَكُ شَيْـًٔا
verses.translation: But does not man call to mind that We created him before out of nothing?
verses.transliteration: Awa la yathkuru al-insanuanna khalaqnahu min qablu walam yaku shay-a

verses.arabic: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَحْشُرَنَّهُمْ وَٱلشَّيَـٰطِينَ ثُمَّ لَنُحْضِرَنَّهُمْ حَوْلَ جَهَنَّمَ جِثِيًّا
verses.translation: So, by thy Lord, without doubt, We shall gather them together, and (also) the Evil Ones (with them); then shall We bring them forth on their knees round about Hell;
verses.transliteration: Fawarabbika lanahshurannahum washshayateenathumma lanuhdirannahum hawla jahannama jithiyya

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ لَنَنزِعَنَّ مِن كُلِّ شِيعَةٍ أَيُّهُمْ أَشَدُّ عَلَى ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عِتِيًّا
verses.translation: Then shall We certainly drag out from every sect all those who were worst in obstinate rebellion against (Allah) Most Gracious.
verses.transliteration: Thumma lananziAAanna min kulli sheeAAatinayyuhum ashaddu AAala arrahmaniAAitiyya

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ لَنَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ أَوْلَىٰ بِهَا صِلِيًّا
verses.translation: And certainly We know best those who are most worthy of being burned therein.
verses.transliteration: Thumma lanahnu aAAlamu billatheenahum awla biha siliyya

verses.arabic: وَإِن مِّنكُمْ إِلَّا وَارِدُهَا ۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ حَتْمًا مَّقْضِيًّا
verses.translation: Not one of you but will pass over it: this is, with thy Lord, a Decree which must be accomplished.
verses.transliteration: Wa-in minkum illa wariduhakana AAala rabbika hatman maqdiyya

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ نُنَجِّى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوا۟ وَّنَذَرُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ فِيهَا جِثِيًّا
verses.translation: But We shall save those who guarded against evil, and We shall leave the wrong-doers therein, (humbled) to their knees.
verses.transliteration: Thumma nunajjee allatheena ittaqawwanatharu aththalimeena feehajithiyya

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتُنَا بَيِّنَـٰتٍ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَىُّ ٱلْفَرِيقَيْنِ خَيْرٌ مَّقَامًا وَأَحْسَنُ نَدِيًّا
verses.translation: When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them, the Unbelievers say to those who believe, "Which of the two sides is best in point of position? Which makes the best show in council?"
verses.transliteration: Wa-itha tutla AAalayhim ayatunabayyinatin qala allatheena kafaroo lillatheenaamanoo ayyu alfareeqayni khayrun maqaman waahsanunadiyya

verses.arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَحْسَنُ أَثَـٰثًا وَرِءْيًا
verses.translation: But how many (countless) generations before them have we destroyed, who were even better in equipment and in glitter to the eye?
verses.transliteration: Wakam ahlakna qablahum min qarnin humahsanu athathan wari/ya

verses.arabic: قُلْ مَن كَانَ فِى ٱلضَّلَـٰلَةِ فَلْيَمْدُدْ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ مَدًّا ۚ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوْا۟ مَا يُوعَدُونَ إِمَّا ٱلْعَذَابَ وَإِمَّا ٱلسَّاعَةَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ شَرٌّ مَّكَانًا وَأَضْعَفُ جُندًا
verses.translation: Say: "If any men go astray, (Allah) Most Gracious extends (the rope) to them, until, when they see the warning of Allah (being fulfilled) - either in punishment or in (the approach of) the Hour,- they will at length realise who is worst in position, and (who) weakest in forces!
verses.transliteration: Qul man kana fee addalalatifalyamdud lahu arrahmanu maddan hattaitha raaw ma yooAAadoona imma alAAathabawa-imma assaAAata fasayaAAlamoona man huwasharrun makanan waadAAafu junda

verses.arabic: وَيَزِيدُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱهْتَدَوْا۟ هُدًى ۗ وَٱلْبَـٰقِيَـٰتُ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتُ خَيْرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوَابًا وَخَيْرٌ مَّرَدًّا
verses.translation: "And Allah doth advance in guidance those who seek guidance: and the things that endure, Good Deeds, are best in the sight of thy Lord, as rewards, and best in respect of (their) eventual return."
verses.transliteration: Wayazeedu Allahu allatheenaihtadaw hudan walbaqiyatu assalihatukhayrun AAinda rabbika thawaban wakhayrun maradda

verses.arabic: أَفَرَءَيْتَ ٱلَّذِى كَفَرَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَقَالَ لَأُوتَيَنَّ مَالًا وَوَلَدًا
verses.translation: Hast thou then seen the (sort of) man who rejects Our Signs, yet says: "I shall certainly be given wealth and children?"
verses.transliteration: Afaraayta allathee kafara bi-ayatinawaqala laootayanna malan wawalada

verses.arabic: أَطَّلَعَ ٱلْغَيْبَ أَمِ ٱتَّخَذَ عِندَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَهْدًا
verses.translation: Has he penetrated to the Unseen, or has he taken a contract with (Allah) Most Gracious?
verses.transliteration: AttalaAAa alghayba ami ittakhathaAAinda arrahmani AAahda

verses.arabic: كَلَّا ۚ سَنَكْتُبُ مَا يَقُولُ وَنَمُدُّ لَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلْعَذَابِ مَدًّا
verses.translation: Nay! We shall record what he says, and We shall add and add to his punishment.
verses.transliteration: Kalla sanaktubu ma yaqooluwanamuddu lahu mina alAAathabi madda

verses.arabic: وَنَرِثُهُۥ مَا يَقُولُ وَيَأْتِينَا فَرْدًا
verses.translation: To Us shall return all that he talks of and he shall appear before Us bare and alone.
verses.transliteration: Wanarithuhu ma yaqoolu waya/teenafarda

verses.arabic: وَٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ءَالِهَةً لِّيَكُونُوا۟ لَهُمْ عِزًّا
verses.translation: And they have taken (for worship) gods other than Allah, to give them power and glory!
verses.transliteration: Wattakhathoo min dooni Allahialihatan liyakoonoo lahum AAizza

verses.arabic: كَلَّا ۚ سَيَكْفُرُونَ بِعِبَادَتِهِمْ وَيَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِمْ ضِدًّا
verses.translation: Instead, they shall reject their worship, and become adversaries against them.
verses.transliteration: Kalla sayakfuroona biAAibadatihimwayakoonoona AAalayhim didda

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينَ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ تَؤُزُّهُمْ أَزًّا
verses.translation: Seest thou not that We have set the Evil Ones on against the unbelievers, to incite them with fury?
verses.transliteration: Alam tara anna arsalna ashshayateenaAAala alkafireena taozzuhum azza

verses.arabic: فَلَا تَعْجَلْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا نَعُدُّ لَهُمْ عَدًّا
verses.translation: So make no haste against them, for We but count out to them a (limited) number (of days).
verses.transliteration: Fala taAAjal AAalayhim innamanaAAuddu lahum AAadda

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ نَحْشُرُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ إِلَى ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ وَفْدًا
verses.translation: The day We shall gather the righteous to (Allah) Most Gracious, like a band presented before a king for honours,
verses.transliteration: Yawma nahshuru almuttaqeena ilaarrahmani wafda

verses.arabic: وَنَسُوقُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ وِرْدًا
verses.translation: And We shall drive the sinners to Hell, like thirsty cattle driven down to water,-
verses.transliteration: Wanasooqu almujrimeena ila jahannamawirda

verses.arabic: لَّا يَمْلِكُونَ ٱلشَّفَـٰعَةَ إِلَّا مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ عِندَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَهْدًا
verses.translation: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from (Allah) Most Gracious.
verses.transliteration: La yamlikoona ashshafaAAatailla mani ittakhatha AAinda arrahmaniAAahda

verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَلَدًا
verses.translation: They say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten a son!"
verses.transliteration: Waqaloo ittakhatha arrahmanuwalada

verses.arabic: لَّقَدْ جِئْتُمْ شَيْـًٔا إِدًّا
verses.translation: Indeed ye have put forth a thing most monstrous!
verses.transliteration: Laqad ji/tum shay-an idda

verses.arabic: تَكَادُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ يَتَفَطَّرْنَ مِنْهُ وَتَنشَقُّ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَتَخِرُّ ٱلْجِبَالُ هَدًّا
verses.translation: At it the skies are ready to burst, the earth to split asunder, and the mountains to fall down in utter ruin,
verses.transliteration: Takadu assamawatuyatafattarna minhu watanshaqqu al-ardu watakhirrualjibalu hadda

verses.arabic: أَن دَعَوْا۟ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ وَلَدًا
verses.translation: That they should invoke a son for (Allah) Most Gracious.
verses.transliteration: An daAAaw lirrahmaniwalada

verses.arabic: وَمَا يَنۢبَغِى لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا
verses.translation: For it is not consonant with the majesty of (Allah) Most Gracious that He should beget a son.
verses.transliteration: Wama yanbaghee lirrahmanian yattakhitha walada

verses.arabic: إِن كُلُّ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّآ ءَاتِى ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَبْدًا
verses.translation: Not one of the beings in the heavens and the earth but must come to (Allah) Most Gracious as a servant.
verses.transliteration: In kullu man fee assamawatiwal-ardi illa atee arrahmaniAAabda

verses.arabic: لَّقَدْ أَحْصَىٰهُمْ وَعَدَّهُمْ عَدًّا
verses.translation: He does take an account of them (all), and hath numbered them (all) exactly.
verses.transliteration: Laqad ahsahum waAAaddahum AAadda

verses.arabic: وَكُلُّهُمْ ءَاتِيهِ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فَرْدًا
verses.translation: And everyone of them will come to Him singly on the Day of Judgment.
verses.transliteration: Wakulluhum ateehi yawma alqiyamatifarda

verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ سَيَجْعَلُ لَهُمُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وُدًّا
verses.translation: On those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, will (Allah) Most Gracious bestow love.
verses.transliteration: Inna allatheena amanoowaAAamiloo assalihati sayajAAalu lahumu arrahmanuwudda

verses.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرْنَـٰهُ بِلِسَانِكَ لِتُبَشِّرَ بِهِ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ وَتُنذِرَ بِهِۦ قَوْمًا لُّدًّا
verses.translation: So have We made the (Qur'an) easy in thine own tongue, that with it thou mayest give Glad Tidings to the righteous, and warnings to people given to contention.
verses.transliteration: Fa-innama yassarnahu bilisanikalitubashshira bihi almuttaqeena watunthira bihi qawmanludda

verses.arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هَلْ تُحِسُّ مِنْهُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ أَوْ تَسْمَعُ لَهُمْ رِكْزًۢا
verses.translation: But how many (countless) generations before them have We destroyed? Canst thou find a single one of them (now) or hear (so much as) a whisper of them?
verses.transliteration: Wakam ahlakna qablahum min qarnin haltuhissu minhum min ahadin aw tasmaAAu lahum rikza
